request.description:
**GET {{URL}}/products/{{EAN_code}}**

**Description:**

This endpoint retrieves information about a product based on its EAN code. It returns details such as:

- the product's warehouse location
    
- expiration date
    

If the product is stored in multiple locations, the endpoint will return all available entries.

**How to use:**

Replace `{{kod_EAN}}` in the URL with the EAN code of the product you want to search for. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/products/5901234567890

 ```

**GET {{URL}}/location/{{location}}**

**Description:**

This endpoint retrieves all products and their details stored at a specific warehouse location. It returns information such as:

- product name or code
    
- quantity
    
- expiration date
    
- any other relevant details
    

**How to use:**

Replace `{{location}}` in the URL with the code of the warehouse location you want to check. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/location/A1-23

 ```

item.name: Move Product By EAN

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
This endpoint allows a warehouse worker to search for all locations where a product with the specified EAN code is stored. It helps the user identify the exact location(s) of the product before starting a relocation process.

The response will include a `relocation_id`, which will be used in the subsequent relocation endpoints to track and complete the process.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{kod_EAN}}` in the URL with the EAN code of the product you want to relocate. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/relocation/start/5901234567890

 ```

**Description:**

This endpoint is the next step in the relocation process. In the request body, the warehouse worker must provide the chosen location.

The specified location will be saved in the `relocation` table under the row with the provided `relocation_id`.

The response will return information about all products at that location, including `product_id`, which must be used in the next step of the relocation process (sent in the request body). If you see in response "Enter amount:", it means, that there is only one product with such EAN in Warehouse

**How to use:**

Replace `{{relocation_id}}` in the URL with the relocation ID obtained from the **Start relocation** step. In the request body, provide the selected location. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/relocation/enter_location/123
Body: {
  "location": "RA-01-01"
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint is used to confirm which product will be relocated. The warehouse worker must provide the `product_id` in the request body, which was returned in the response of the previous step (**Enter relocation location**).

The `relocation_id` in the URL should be the same ID used in the previous relocation steps. This ensures the action is applied to the correct relocation process.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{relocation_id}}` in the URL with the relocation ID from previous steps. Include the `product_id` in the request body. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/relocation/confirm_date/123
Body: {
  "product_id": 456
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint is used to specify the quantity of the selected product to be relocated.

The `relocation_id` in the URL should be the same ID used in the previous relocation steps. In the request body, provide the quantity of the product you want to move, using the same format as in the previous steps.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{relocation_id}}` in the URL with the relocation ID from previous steps. Include the desired quantity in the request body. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/relocation/confirm_amount/123
Body: {
  "quantity": 10
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint is used to specify the target location for the product being relocated.

The `relocation_id` in the URL should be the same ID used in the previous relocation steps. In the request body, provide one of the valid warehouse locations where the product will be moved, following the same format as in the previous steps.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{relocation_id}}` in the URL with the relocation ID from previous steps. Include the chosen target location in the request body. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/relocation/confirm_target_location/123
Body: {
  "target_location": "B2-15"
}

 ```

item.description:
**Description:**  
  
This folder contains endpoints for relocating products by their EAN code. Each relocation process moves a product from one warehouse location to another and is tracked with a unique ID in the `relocation` table.

The relocation process is divided into multiple steps. All relocations should start with the **Get products by EAN** function, followed by the subsequent steps to complete the process.

EndFragment

request.description:
**Description:**

This endpoint allows you to create a new user account. Provide the required data in the request body according to the specified arguments.

- `user_id` must be **2 characters long**
    
- `password` must be **no more than 4 characters**
    

**How to use:**

Include the user credentials in the request body. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/authentication/register
Body: {
  "user_id": "AB",
  "password": "1234"
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint allows a user to log in. Provide the credentials of a user that has already been registered in the database.

If you just registered a new user, use the following example credentials:

- `user_id`: `KS`
    
- `password`: `1`
    

**How to use:**  
  
Include the user credentials in the request body. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/authentication/login
Body: {
  "user_id": "KS",
  "password": "1"
}

 ```

item.name: Execute order
Start Order

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
This endpoint initiates the order execution process.  
  
In the URL, provide the `order_id` of the order you selected earlier.

The response will display the first product to be picked, along with its details.  
  
These product details will be required in the following steps of the order execution process.

ðŸ’¡ Tip: Itâ€™s recommended **not to close the response window**, as it contains important information for the next steps.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the order you want to start. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/execute_order/start_order/789

 ```

**Description:**

This endpoint is used to confirm the location of the currently picked product.

The location should match the one shown in the response of the **Start Order** or **Get Next Product** function.

The `order_id` in the URL must correspond to the order being executed.

In the request body, provide the confirmed location.

**How to use:**

Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the correct order ID.

In the body, enter the location as shown in the previous step. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/execute_order/confirm_location/789
Body: {
  "location": "RA-01-01"
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function confirms the **EAN code** of the currently picked product.  
  
In a real warehouse workflow, the operator scans the productâ€™s barcode (EAN) to verify that the correct item has been selected.

The endpoint requires:

- a valid **`order_id`** (from previous steps such as _Start Order_ or _Get Next Product_),
    
- the **EAN code** of the product provided in the **body**, which was shown in the _Confirm Location_ response.
    

**Request Body (JSON):**

```
{
  "ean": "1234567890123"
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function confirms that the warehouse operator has picked the **correct quantity** of the product.  
  
The required amount is shown in the response of **Start Order** or **Get Next Product**.

The endpoint requires:

- a valid **`order_id`** (the current order being executed),
    
- the **confirmed quantity** in the **request body**.
    

**Request Body (JSON):**

```
{
  "amount": 10
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function retrieves the **next product to be picked** in the order.  
  
It should be called **after confirming the correct quantity** of the previous product.

The response will display the details of the product that needs to be collected in the next step.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the current order. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/execute_order/get_next_product/789

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function displays all products that have been collected so far for the specified order.  
  
It allows the warehouse worker to review which items have already been picked.

The `order_id` in the URL should correspond to the current order being executed.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the order. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/execute_order/show_done_products/789

 ```

item.description:
**Description:**

This section contains endpoints used for executing an order.

The process should be carried out step by step, following the sequence indicated by the system.

Messages and instructions for the next steps will be displayed in the response after each request.

Always begin the order execution with the **Start Order** function

request.description:
**Description:**

This endpoint is used during the order execution process to remove a product from the list of already collected items.

It is typically used when a warehouse worker realizes that a product was picked incorrectly (e.g., wrong expiration date) or is damaged. Using this function ensures that the specified quantity of the product is not deducted from the inventory.

The `order_id` in the URL should correspond to the order being processed. In body You have to use product_id

**How to use:**

Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the order. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/execute_order/reverse_product/789

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint returns a list of all orders that are ready to be executed.

The response includes key details for each order, such as:

- `order_id` â€“ the main identifier used throughout the entire order execution process
    
- total quantity to pick
    
- buyer information
    
- estimated total weight of all products in the order
    

Use this function to choose which order you want to start processing.

**How to use:**  
  
Simply send a `GET` request to view all available orders ready for execution. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/execute_order/order_choice

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This endpoint displays detailed information about a specific order.  
  
It shows all products that need to be picked along with their required quantities.

The `order_id` in the URL identifies which orderâ€™s details will be retrieved.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{order_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the order you want to check. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/execute_order/check_order/789

 ```

item.description:
**Description:**  
  
This folder contains endpoints for executing orders that have already been entered into the system. The order execution process is divided into sequential steps.

Each warehouse action involves:

- confirming the product location,
    
- confirming the EAN code,
    
- optionally confirming the expiration date (if the same product exists at the location with different dates),
    
- and finally confirming the quantity.
    

It is recommended to start the process with the **Order Choice** function to check which orders are ready to be executed. The **Check order details** function allows you to see which products need to be picked for each order.

Tip: choose orders with the smallest quantities first, as processing large orders can be time-consuming.

item.name: Execute Delivery

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
This function displays the details of a delivery based on the specified `deliver_id`.  
  
It shows which items need to be received and their respective quantities.

ðŸ’¡ **Tip:** It is recommended **not to close the response window**, as the information from the response will be needed for the next steps of the delivery process.

The `deliver_id` in the URL should correspond to the delivery you want to process.

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{deliver_id}}` in the URL with the ID of the delivery. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/delivery/check_delivery/301

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function confirms the receipt of a product based on its **EAN code(must consist of 13 digit)**.

The endpoint requires:

- a valid **`deliver_id`** in the URL corresponding to the delivery being processed
    
- the **EAN code** of the product to be received in the request body
    

**Request Body Example:**

```
{
  "ean": "1234567890123"
}

 ```

**Description:**

This function sets the **expiration date** (or relevant date) for a product in the delivery.

The endpoint requires:

- the correct **`deliver_id`** in the URL
    
- the **EAN code** of the product from the previous step (_Enter EAN From Delivery_) in the URL
    
- the **date** in the request body in `YYYY-MM-DD` format
    

**Request Body Example:**

```
{
  "date": "2025-12-31"
}

 ```

Replace `{{deliver_id}}` and `{{kod_EAN}}` in the URL with the appropriate delivery ID and product EAN. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/delivery/enter_date/301/1234567890123
Body: {
  "date": "2025-12-31"
}

 ```

**Description:**  
  
This function sets the **quantity of a product** to be received according to the amount shown in the **Check Delivery** response.

If you want to receive **more than the planned quantity**, include the argument `"force": true` in the request body.

The endpoint requires:

- the correct **`deliver_id`** in the URL
    
- the **EAN code** of the product in the URL
    
- the **quantity** to be received in the request body
    

StartFragment

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{deliver_id}}` and `{{kod_EAN}}` in the URL with the appropriate delivery ID and product EAN. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/delivery/enter_amount_delivery/301/1234567890123
Body: {
  "quantity": 10,
  "force": true
}

 ```

EndFragment

**Description:**  
  
This function sets the **warehouse location** where the received product will be stored.

The endpoint requires:

- the correct **`deliver_id`** in the URL
    
- the **EAN code** of the product in the URL
    
- the **location** in the request body, which must exist in the database
    

**How to use:**  
  
Replace `{{deliver_id}}` and `{{kod_EAN}}` in the URL with the appropriate delivery ID and product EAN. Example:

```
POST {{URL}}/delivery/enter_location_delivery/301/1234567890123
Body: {
  "location": "A1-23"
}

 ```

item.description:
**Description:**

This folder contains endpoints for **executing a supplier delivery**.

The delivery process is carried out in several sequential steps.

It is recommended to start with the **Check Deliver** function, using the selected `deliver_id` to begin processing the delivery.

Each step of the process should be followed in order to ensure that all products are correctly received and recorded

item.name: Create delivery

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
This function creates a **supplier delivery document**, assigns it a `deliver_id`, and links it to a supplier as specified in the request body.

In the body, you must provide:

- `"supplier"` â€“ the supplier must exist in the `suppliers` table
    
- `"deliver_external_number"` â€“ optional, can be assigned freely
    
- `"delivery_date"` â€“ optional, can be assigned freely
    

The response will include a newly generated `deliver_id`, which should be used in the **Create Delivery Details Document** function.

**Request Body Example:**

```
{
  "supplier": "Exotic Liquids",
  "deliver_external_number": "ZO/2000123/2025",
  "delivery_date": "2025-12-31"
}

 ```

item.description:
**Description:**  
  
This function is used to **create a new delivery to be received**.

The process should start with the **Create Supplier Delivery Document** function, which will:

- generate a `deliver_id`
    
- select the supplier
    

A new record with the generated `deliver_id` will be created in the `delivery_order` table.

Next, proceed to **Create Delivery Details Document**, where you will use the previously generated `deliver_id` to add products and details for the delivery.

request.description:
**Description:**  
  
This function retrieves a list of **available supplier deliveries** that are ready to be processed.  
  
It allows the warehouse worker to see which deliveries can be received and acted upon.

**How to use:**  
  
Simply send a `GET` request to view all pending deliveries. Example:

```
GET {{URL}}/delivery/check_supplier_deliver

 ```
